title: LG Nexus 5X (2015) – Everything you need to know | Trusted Reviews
description: ![Nexus 5 pics13]()_USB-C, as seen on the OnePlus 2_Back at I/O, Google lauded the benefits of USB-C, and said it would be workinghard to support the rollout of the technology.The renders we’ve seen of the Nexus 5 also feature the burgeoning connectionstandard, so it’s almost assured that USB-C will feature on the new Nexusdevices.Other, less impressive features include Wi-Fi support, an NFC chip, andBluetooth 4.2 connectivity.**Related:[OnePlus 2review](https://www.trustedreviews.com/oneplus-2-review)****Nexus 5 (2015) price:**The LG Nexus 5 (2015) price is an interesting one, mainly because we’re notsure how Google wants to position its new smartphone.The 2013 Nexus 5 retailed at £199 for the 16GB version, and £220 for the 32GBmodel.However, Google ditched its budget Nexus pricing last year with the £499 Nexus6 – many fans of the series saw that as a betrayal.As such, it’s tough to pin down an exact price for the Nexus 5.If the phone uses a high-end chip like the 810, it’s probably going to bear asimilar price to the Nexus 6 – we’d say £350 would be the bare minimum, but itcould rise to £500.However, if LG opts for a Snapdragon 620 chip, then a mid-range price tagwould be more appropriate – somewhere in the region of £200 to £300.It’s also worth noting that Google is expected to flog a Huawei-built Nexus 6this year too, which will likely cost more than the Nexus 5 due to the boostedscreen size.**Share your thoughts on what you’d like to see from the LG Nexus 5 (2015) inthe comments below.**
